com

Class AbstractCommunicator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.AbstractCommunicator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Communicator, java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClientCommunicator, ServerCommunicator

    public abstract class AbstractCommunicator
extends java.lang.Object
implements Communicator
    An abstracting class for the two different Communicators. Contains basic functionality and utility.

      • AbstractCommunicator

        protected AbstractCommunicator(int port)
        Parameters:
        port - Port for the socket to use.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Mainloop which tries to maintain a connection to another communicator. When a connection is established, all listeners will be notified. If a connection is established, data will be sent/received. If a communicator is lost, it looks for another one till found.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • setState

        public void setState(MopedState state)
        Description copied from interface: Communicator
        Adds the new state to the queue of data to be sent to another communicator. Will call onStateChange(MopedState state) on the CommunicationListeners registered to the other communicator.
        Specified by:
        setState in interface Communicator
        Parameters:
        state - The state to add to the queue.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(MopedDataType type,
                     int value)
        Description copied from interface: Communicator
        Adds a new value of given type to the queue of data to be sent to another communicator. Will call onValueChanged(MopedDataType type, int Value) on the CommunicationListeners registered to the other communicator
        Specified by:
        setValue in interface Communicator
        Parameters:
        type - The type of data to be added
        value - The value of the data

      • addListener

        public void addListener(CommunicationListener cl)
        Description copied from interface: Communicator
        Adds a CommunicationListener to the list of listeners.
        Specified by:
        addListener in interface Communicator
        Parameters:
        cl - CommunicationListener to be added.

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from interface: Communicator
        Starts a Communicator in a new thread. Must be called for communicator to start communicating. If the queue contains items, the queue will be cleared. A communicator may only be started/stopped once.
        Specified by:
        start in interface Communicator

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from interface: Communicator
        Stops the Communicator from communicating. Use start() to start communicating once again. If data is queued to be sent and stop is called, the queue doesn't get cleared. Queue does get cleared in start() though. A communicator may only be started/stopped once.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Communicator

      • handleDisconnect

        protected abstract void handleDisconnect()

      • notifyConnected

        protected void notifyConnected()
        Notifies all listeners that a connection has been established.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Description copied from interface: Communicator
        Returns if the mainThread is still running or not
        Specified by:
        isRunning in interface Communicator
        Returns:
        boolean

      • clearConnection

        protected abstract void clearConnection()
        Closes the socket, nullifies it and nullifies the in/output-streams. This is necessary because one communicator acts as a server and the other one as a client.

      • connectSocket

        protected abstract void connectSocket()
                               throws java.net.SocketTimeoutException
        Does the necessary setup for the sockets to establish a connection. This is necessary because one communicator needs to act as a server and the other one as a client.
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketTimeoutException - thrown if the socket is not connected in a certain time span

      • log

        protected void log(java.lang.Object object)
        Prints the given object in out.println and adds which thread printed it, but only if logging is enabled;
        Parameters:
        object - the object to log

      • isLoggingEnabled

        public boolean isLoggingEnabled()
        Specified by:
        isLoggingEnabled in interface Communicator
        Returns:
        True if logging is enabled, false otherwise.
